abstract: Newly declassified report on NSA surveillance program under Pres George W Bush  contextualizes clash in 2004 between Bush and his attorney general, who was hospitalized at time, over program's scope and legality; bedside debate led to president retroactively authorizing collection of domestic phone records, which have since been deemed illegal.
lead_paragraph: Newly disclosed information sheds light on a Bush administration fight in March 2004 about the post-9/11 surveillance and data-collection program.

headline.main: George W. Bush Made Retroactive N.S.A. ‘Fix’ After Hospital Room Showdown
headline.print_headline: Bush Made Retroactive N.S.A. ‘Fix’ After Hospital Room Showdown

snippet: Newly disclosed information sheds light on a Bush administration fight in March 2004 about the post-9/11 surveillance and data-collection program.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
